class_notes: (Same as MESAS 190 2) This course is a survey of the Modern Jewish literary canon and its most significant achievements over three continents and 130 years. The source material (in English) ranges from stories and poetry written in Eastern-Europe and the United States to literature composed in Palestine and Israel. The goals of this course are to introduce students to the breadth and depth of this literary tradition, to develop critical reading skills, and a set of academic skills necessary for academic performance.
course_description: Designed to engage first-year students in aspects of inquiry and research into areas of Jewish religion, culture, history, or language. Topics will vary.
sections: Class Nbr: 4443, Section #: 2, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: O. Yeglin, Status: Open
